description: We exist to wow our customers. We know we’re doing the right thing when we hear our customers say, “How did we ever live without Coupang?” Born out of an obsession to make shopping, eating, and living easier than ever, we’re collectively disrupting the multi-billion-dollar e-commerce industry from the ground up. We are one of the fastest-growing e-commerce companies that established an unparalleled reputation for being a dominant and reliable force in South Korean commerce. We are proud to have the best of both worlds — a startup culture with the resources of a large global public company. This fuels us to continue our growth and launch new services at the speed we have been since our inception. We are all entrepreneurial surrounded by opportunities to drive new initiatives and innovations. At our core, we are bold and ambitious people that like to get our hands dirty and make a hands-on impact. At Coupang, you will see yourself, your colleagues, your team, and the company grow every day. Our mission to build the future of commerce is real. We push the boundaries of what’s possible to solve problems and break traditional tradeoffs. Join Coupang now to create an epic experience in this always-on, high-tech, and hyper-connected world. The Global Operation Tech (GOT) organization is responsible for the systems that enable Coupang to reliably deliver to customers within hours of orders being placed. GOT is on a mission to innovate logistics by building an efficient delivery network at breakthrough scale and speeds. As a Senior Staff Data Scientist in GOT, you will leverage advanced algorithms to improve Coupang’s customer experience by ensuring ultra-fast deliveries are on time even during the busiest times of the year. We are looking for a Scientist that can drive the direction of technology across multiple teams, leverage deep industry knowledge and use statistical and machine learning techniques to bring value to customers. The ideal candidates are pragmatic, resourceful, and embrace challenges that are seemingly impossible. The ideal candidates also have rich industry experience and a track record of delivering highly impactful projects. Basic Qualifications: Masters degree in a quantitative discipline: statistics, operations research, computer science, informatics, engineering, applied mathematics, economics or equivalent experience. 10+ years of experience in solving complex problems in the area of operations research and developing strategies for large-scale supply chain, transportation and logistic networks. Perform quantitative, economic, and numerical analysis of the performance of large-scale systems under uncertainty using statistical and optimization tools such as Python, R and Xpress/Gurobi/CPLEX/etc to determine optimal and heuristic solution strategies for optimization problems. Apply theories of mathematical optimization, including linear programming, combinatorial optimization, integer programming, dynamic programming, network flows and algorithms to design optimal or near optimal solution methodologies to be used by in-house decision support tools and software. Excellent written and verbal communication skills while addressing both technical and business people; ability to speak at a level appropriate for the audience. The ideal candidate should be able to present business cases, and document models, analyses, and results to influence important decisions. Proven ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team. Preferred Qualifications: PhD degree in a quantitative discipline: statistics, operations research, computer science, informatics, engineering, applied mathematics, economics, etc. 10+ years of hands-on experience applying theoretical models in an applied environment. Experience in supply chains, transportation and logistics, and network optimization models. Proficiency in model development, model validation and model implementation for large-scale applications.

job_title: Blue Team DART – Staff Security Analyst
description: As our Cyber Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT) for our Seattle office, you will be a part of our special forces within the BlueTeam. You must have a calm and collected mannerism in high-pressure and time sensitive situations, think like both an attacker and defender, and work with relevant teams to take the right and timely actions to analyze, respond and neutralize attacks. The BlueTeam is responsible for the detection and response to credible threats. We work hands-on developing detective capabilities, identifying mitigations to vulnerabilities and respond to potential threats to Coupang systems. BlueTeam CSIRT Engineers are unique individuals prepared to relentlessly resolve security issues by gathering and analyzing event data and conducting root-cause analysis. The Senior Security Engineer position requires an experienced CSIRT personnel that have expert working knowledge in IR, investigation and hunt techniques, root-cause security flaws and vulnerabilities, quickly assessing the potential cyber threats. Security Engineers are also expected to develop elegant solutions to complex problems and apply appropriate technologies while following security engineering best practices. Responsibilities include analyzing and responding to security anomalies, intrusion attempts, and breaches, conducting root cause analysis, threat hunting, ticket review, and collaborating effectively with internal teams. Minimum qualifications include a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent professional experience, and 4 years of experience in information Security with experience in Cyber Security Incident Analysis. Preferred qualifications include 12+ years of experience in information security with at least 8+ years as a Cyber Security Incident Analyst, experience in host-based security investigation, analyzing security events, and automation and scripting skills.

We are looking for a dynamic, motivated communications professional to join our growing Global Government Affairs team. This role is ideal for someone with 10 to 15 years of experience, who has worked in the public policy space, either in government, on Capitol Hill, or in an agency setting in a related capacity. The successful candidate will be a “jack of all trades” communicator with a high bar for excellence who is ready to support a fast-paced global public affairs team. This person should be a self-starter who can think big, own their space, and is comfortable juggling multiple projects under tight deadlines. Experience with content creation, media relations, social media, event planning, and strategic communications campaigns is ideal. Prior experience in the technology sector is helpful. What You Will Do: Support development and execution of PR and communications strategies that build Coupang’s reputation and visibility with policymakers, stakeholders, and media. Assist in creating written communications, including press releases, media statements, briefing documents, Q&As, talking points, and newsletters, and blog posts. Monitor media, social channels, and policy news for stories relevant to Coupang; provide regular updates and media coverage reports. Help plan and execute events, briefings, and stakeholder engagements. Maintain media lists, stakeholder databases, and track outreach activities. Assist with coordination of external consultants, agencies, and vendors. Provide logistical and administrative support for the communications team to ensure projects run smoothly. Contribute creative ideas for campaigns, storytelling, and ways to strengthen Coupang’s reputation. Basic Qualifications: 10-15 years of experience in communications, public relations, public affairs, or related field. Strong writing and editing skills with the ability to tailor messages to different audiences, including crafting op-eds, blogs, and thought leadership content. Experience with media relations and an interest in working with journalists. Prior experience supporting strategic multi-faceted communications campaigns with measurable results. Experience with event planning and logistics. Ability to manage multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and adapt in a fast-moving environment. Comfort with data analysis to track communications performance. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. A collaborative and proactive team player with a “roll up your sleeves” attitude. Curiosity and eagerness to learn new skills across the PR/communications spectrum. Preferred Qualifications: Experience working with global corporations and/or tech companies. Experience with digital advertising, sponsored content, and SEO. Graphic design and video editing skills.

We are looking for a hands-on Director of Engineering with deep technical expertise and a passion for building secure, reliable, and scalable systems. This role combines technical architecture leadership with people and delivery management. You will lead a team of talented senior engineers while staying close to the code and system design. Your mission includes driving the security, quality, and reliability of our core platforms and AI systems while mentoring engineers, scaling engineering excellence, and partnering closely with product and leadership on strategic roadmaps. Responsibilities include building and growing a high-performing team, designing and leading architecture of secure systems, integrating Generative AI capabilities, defining API security patterns, leading authentication and identity management solutions, and championing cryptography and compliance frameworks. Basic qualifications include a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, 8+ years in software development and security engineering, and expertise in Java, Spring Boot, and AWS architecture/services. Preferred qualifications include recent hands-on experience with secure, distributed systems, cloud platforms, and data security principles.

We exist to wow our customers. We know we’re doing the right thing when we hear our customers say, “How did we ever live without Coupang?” Born out of an obsession to make shopping, eating, and living easier than ever, we’re collectively disrupting the multi-billion-dollar e-commerce industry from the ground up. We are one of the fastest-growing e-commerce companies that established an unparalleled reputation for being a dominant and reliable force in South Korean commerce. We are proud to have the best of both worlds — a startup culture with the resources of a large global public company. This fuels us to continue our growth and launch new services at the speed we have been since our inception. We are all entrepreneurs surrounded by opportunities to drive new initiatives and innovations. At our core, we are bold and ambitious people that like to get our hands dirty and make a hands-on impact. At Coupang, you will see yourself, your colleagues, your team, and the company grow every day. Our mission to build the future of commerce is real. We push the boundaries of what’s possible to solve problems and break traditional tradeoffs. Join Coupang now to create an epic experience in this always-on, high-tech, and hyper-connected world. The Coupang Media Group (CMG) is the advertising platform team within Coupang. We are a globally distributed team focused on delivering advertising solutions for those that sell products on our platform. This includes display, search, performance, brand, and video ads offerings. With the latest advances in AI/ML, we have the opportunity to rethink the traditional ads stack to deliver unique high-quality experiences to our customers that were traditionally outside the realm of possibility. This is a senior individual contributor role focusing on creating new ad experiences and improving existing ad experiences across Coupang's apps and websites. What You Will Do: Product ownership for CMG Ads. Define the product vision, strategy, and roadmap to re-imagine our ads experience to deliver unique customer experiences while directing day-to-day execution towards the vision. Launch and improve ad products that surface highly relevant results for consumers and better conversion for advertisers. Work closely with business, engineering, internal/external partners, and customers to define project requirements and success criteria. Effectively communicate, collaborate and drive alignment with a variety of stakeholders including senior executives to ensure highly scalable and performance end-to-end experience for advertisers and shoppers. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience. 8+ years of product management experience developing and launching products in the advertising or recommendations domain. Proven ability to deliver in a complex stakeholder and partner team environment. Hands-on experience working in an Agile environment with a short iteration cadence. Multiple successful launches of V1 products in a rapid growth environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to understand technical challenges and make educated trade-offs. Preferred Qualifications: e-commerce experience. Master’s degree in an analytical or engineering discipline or MBA preferred. Experience working in international environments and globally distributed team.

As the Director of Product Management for High Performance Compute (HPC), you will own the strategy, roadmap, and execution of our compute product line that powers some of the most advanced AI and data workloads across the company. This is a critical leadership role that defines the direction of our infrastructure capabilities and plays a central part in enabling internal and partner teams to scale AI and ML innovation. You will bring deep technical insight and product ownership to define how compute resources are designed, delivered, and evolved to meet growing demand. Your work will shape how next generation workloads such as model training, simulation, large-scale processing, and inference are supported across a variety of environments, ensuring our platform remains flexible, performant and future ready. This is a highly strategic role that sits at the intersection of infrastructure, data, and AI, and requires a strong mix of technical depth, customer empathy, and executional leadership. Key Responsibilities include defining the product vision and roadmap for our cloud platform, identifying and prioritizing compute requirements, working cross-functionally with engineering, and ensuring operational excellence.

Performs various duties related to FC Operations, including but not limited to Inbound, Inventory, Replenishment, Outbound, and Maintenance departments. Associates will be cross-trained before being assigned to a designated area. Responsibilities include operating an RF gun/PDA device, breaking down, receiving, and inspecting inbound items, keeping record of inventory, reconciling discrepancies, moving items and carts, picking, packing, stacking, and shipping items, communicating issues or damages, maintaining safety and housekeeping standards, and may participate in training new associates. Preferred qualifications include effective communication, basic math, computer literacy, ability to work independently or as part of a team, learning aptitude, detail-oriented, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment around machinery. Physical demands include the ability to remain in a stationary position for 10+ hours, move and walk for 10+ hours, bend and lift up to 50 lbs, and push/pull up to 50 lbs of exerted force.

Operates industrial machinery and transports items from one location within the FC to another. May work in various departments, such Inbound, Replenishment, Outbound, and Maintenance. Responsibilities include performing daily forklift maintenance safety inspection, following forklift safety protocols, operating forklifts, balers, scrubbers, and pallet trucks, transporting products, sorting and organizing products, operating an RF gun/PDA device, keeping record of inventory, reconciling discrepancies, consolidating products, moving items and carts, communicating issues or damages, maintaining safety and housekeeping standards, and may participate in training new drivers. Physical demands include remaining stationary for 10+ hours, moving and walking for 10+ hours, bending and lifting up to 50 lbs, and pushing/pulling up to 50 lbs. Preferred qualifications include a High School diploma or GED and forklift experience.

Reconciles discrepancies in inventory. Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned including but not limited to data entry, consolidation, physical location checks. Cycle Counts: Systemically account for all items that are physically in a single location and fix any quantity discrepancies that exist in the FC using a PDA device. Expiry Pull: Remove expired product from inventory using the adjustment function. A list is provided to determine which product will be pulled based on the each item’s shelf life. Audits: Check put aways to correct discrepancies and any poor quality put aways found. Adjustments: Utilize the adjustment function to correct discrepancies when needed and fulfill production needs. Consolidation: Move product from one location to another utilizing a PDA. Basic Qualifications: Effective communication, Computer Literacy, Teamwork, Learning Aptitude, Detail Oriented, Ability to work fast paced. Work environment: Fast Paced, Noise Levels varies, High and low warehouse seasonal temperatures, Minimal exposure to dust. Physical demands: Must be able to stand 10+ hours. Must be able to bend and lift up to 60 lbs. Must be able to push/pull up to 50 lbs of exerted force. Preferred education and experience: High school diploma or GED, Similar FC / Inventory Control experience.

Safety is a top priority at Coupang and all Coupang hires must have a safety-first mindset. The Operations Lead will perform various duties within assigned department to facilitate operations safely at the Riverside Fulfillment Center (FC). Areas responsible may include but not limited to Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS), Quality, Inbound, Inventory, Replenishment, Outbound, and Maintenance. As a leader of the team, you will provide safety leadership, train new hires, be a key contributor in safety programs, participate in department meetings, engage other FC workers, assist in developing standard operating procedures, and generate necessary reports. Responsibilities include providing training for new hires and existing workers on various topics including safety, quality, operations, maintenance, and others as required; providing oversight and direction to FC workers; ensuring all required trainings are completed; developing solutions to issues that come up in the FC; engaging FC workers, encouraging a safe and positive work environment; assisting in developing and ensuring execution of standard operating procedures; operating an RF gun/PDA device; maintaining safety and housekeeping standards in the FC; overseeing operational processes; reviewing workload and assigning tasks to employees; training and coaching warehouse team; establishing exceptional customer service; interpreting and enforcing company policies and safety procedures; and providing support to warehouse management. Competencies include proactive critical thinking, effective communication, basic math, computer literacy, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
